activities: Consilience International LLC designs and licenses a software framework for use by commercial and public organizations for managing their operations. In this context Consilience customers will use Consilience software to manage profiles of their personnel that will likely include personal information. Consilience itself will not directly interact with any such customer information other than in the course of performing routine maintenance and support.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech: EU data protection authorities and the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner are available to investigate unresolved disputes that concern human resources data.   Consilience has signed a Participation Agreement with the Council of Better Business Bureaus, which has specific published mechanisms for managing unresolved complaints.  The latter will be available to investigate unresolved disputes that do not concern human resources data.
